image.altText: hand puts a ballot into a voting ballot box

props.synopsis: Some names you may know, others you probably won't — the candidates are revealing themselves ahead of the Tasmanian state election.

title.children: Candidates coming forward ahead of Tasmania's state election

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: After a nail-biting few days of "will they, won't they, could they, should they," Tasmania's very, very early election is full steam ahead. And whoever wins on July 19 owes voters a better effort than the last parliament.

title.children: Liberals, Labor hamstrung on key issues in Tasmanian election no-one wanted

image.altText: Rows of seats in an arc inside a large room

props.synopsis: This snap election may well end 11 years of Liberal government in Tasmania. But in a state with a history of long-running Labor governments, it's far from clear if this election will usher in a new era of stable politics.

title.children: Will this election herald new era of stable politics? Don't bet on it

image.altText: Have your say for the Tasmanian election.

props.synopsis: We want to know what issues matter most to you and what you want us to find out as Tasmania goes to another election.

title.children: Your Say: Tell us what matters to you this Tasmanian election

image.altText: A middle aged man in a black suit stands in a fancy wood-paneled room

props.synopsis: Tasmanians will head to the polls in five weeks, after Governor Barbara Baker accepted the premier's request for an early election — the second in 15 months for the state.

title.children: Tasmanian election called for July 19 as governor accepts request

image.altText: A man with a white beard looks out a window in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: John planned to live out his days at a caravan park but was issued an eviction notice after nearly two years. He took the case to the Supreme Court which has ruled the eviction attempt "invalid and of no effect".

title.children: Caravan resident wins fight against eviction, Liberals pledge better protections

image.altText: Peter George stands outside a school building

props.synopsis: Peter George says it would be 'wrong' for him not to stand as an independent for Franklin in the Tasmanian state election.

title.children: Peter George confirms he'll run for state parliament as an independent

image.altText: Blonde woman with paper in front of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Independent Member for Clark, Kristie Johnston, says she hopes this state election sees more independents and minor parties elected.

title.children: Independent MP Kristie Johnston hopes for even bigger crossbench

image.altText: An LA shopping mall burns in a huge orange fire as a shirtless man on a motorbike and an amblance park down the road.

props.synopsis: In 1992 the National Guard was called into Los Angeles to help control widespread, destructive rioting. But right now those forces appear to be escalating the situation and some experts are warning it is all in the name of "political theatre".

title.children: 'It's a very different scale': The difference between LA now and in 1992

image.altText: The former PM seated and grinning

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison labels critics of AUKUS and the US alliance delusional.

title.children: Morrison labels AUKUS, US alliance critics 'delusional' — as it happened

image.altText: A hand holding orange dirt

props.synopsis: A Melbourne small business finds itself unwittingly on the frontline of the trade stand-off between Donald Trump and Xi Jinping, as rare earths present an opportunity for Australia.

title.children: Rare earth magnet crisis creates an Australian opportunity

image.altText: Girl with blue nails applying sunscreen to arm

props.synopsis: Sunscreen testing released by consumer group Choice might have alarmed you, so here's what experts want you to know about staying safe in the sun.

title.children: How can you trust your sunscreen is effective?

image.altText: Close-up of a young woman applying sunscreen on her tanned shoulder to protect her skin from the sun.

props.synopsis: Sunscreen testing by Choice finds many popular brands do not meet their SPF claims, but experts say sunscreens remain safe and effective.

title.children: Only four of 20 popular sunscreens pass Choice's SPF testing

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal men walk through the town of Alice Springs, one man holding a protest sign.

props.synopsis: The peak body for Indigenous legal services says the prime minister is "missing in action" and should convene a national cabinet meeting over rising Aboriginal incarceration rates and deaths in custody.

title.children: PM accused of being 'missing in action' on Indigenous deaths in custody

image.altText: Brittany looks into the camera, as other cameras are pointed at her while she walks along.

props.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission has investigated corruption claims made regarding a settlement paid by the Commonwealth to former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Corruption watchdog clears Brittany Higgins's $2.4 million payout

image.altText: A man in a pink shirt smiling

props.synopsis: The man whose genius for melody, arrangements and wide-eyed self-expression inspired summertime anthems was as pitied for his demons as he was celebrated for his gifts.

title.children: The Beach Boys' Brian Wilson was a visionary leader and troubled genius

image.altText: Liberal party MP Moira Deeming exits from a joint party meeting, wearing a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Independent Broad-based Anti-Corruption Commission has been asked to investigate Moira Deeming's offer to delay bankruptcy proceedings against John Pesutto.

title.children: Moira Deeming referred to corruption investigators over John Pesutto offer

image.altText: An aerial view of coastline.

props.synopsis: While existing properties can remain, the City of Busselton's decision bans all future unhosted short-stay accommodation from residential areas of the popular coastal WA region.

title.children: New Busselton Airbnb crackdown aims to get locals into houses

image.altText: Two high-rise office building in a green open space

props.synopsis: A 38-storey office building with shops, restaurants and a public plaza is set to tower over South Australia's Parliament House, after the proposal was given planning approval despite concerns about heritage.

title.children: Skyscraper behind SA Parliament House gets green light despite heritage fears

image.altText: Karratha Gas Plant  2023-08-08 08:08:00

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt flags possible delays to Woodside’s response to his provisional approval of an extension to the the controversial North West Shelf project.

title.children: Timeline could lapse in Woodside's North West Shelf extension negotiations

image.altText: A man wearing a navy tuxedo and bow tie turns his outstretched palms upwards

props.synopsis: Khaby Lame, the world's most-followed TikTok personality, has voluntarily departed the US after he was detained by immigration officers in Las Vegas.

title.children: Popular TikTok personality leaves US as pro-Trump influencer boasts of reporting him

image.altText: A punter playing the poker machines in a Sydney club

props.synopsis: A leading charity describes the system governing poker machines as "broken" following a damning auditor-general's report.

title.children: NSW failing to reduce gambling harm from pokies, damning report shows

image.altText: Solar panels installed on a roof

props.synopsis: More than 8 million solar panels will be decommissioned annually in the coming years, as batteries drive the next solar wave. With only about 10 per cent of panels recycled, waste is a major issue, with many stockpiled, sent overseas or ending up in landfill.

title.children: Millions of panels dumped as solar upgrades rise

image.altText: Pump jack

props.synopsis: Oil prices leap to two-month highs, with Brent crude up 5 per cent overnight. The energy sector leads the gains on the ASX 200. Look back on the trading day with the ABC business and markets blog.

title.children: Oil prices leap on Middle East tensions, energy stocks lead ASX — as it happened

image.altText: a freshly caught pink snapper

props.synopsis: Shoppers are warned Australian seafood prices will rise under plans to prevent commercial fishing in millions of hectares of ocean, announced by the federal government at a UN conference this week.

title.children: Fishers say high seafood prices the trade-off for more protected ocean

image.altText: couch in living room with coffee table and window

props.synopsis: From rugs covering water damage, to artificial lighting making spaces look brighter, stylists use all kinds of tricks when staging a home for sale.

title.children: 'Rugs covering floor damage': What to know when inspecting a staged home

image.altText: Two women stand in front of a building damaged in strikes, one wearing a robe.

props.synopsis: A concentrated, nine-minute-long Russian drone attack has terrorised residents of Ukraine's second-largest city, killing at least six people and injuring more than 60.

title.children: Kharkiv residents terrorised by nine-minute-long drone barrage

image.altText: Joanne Ciconte with the visor on her helmet lifted, looking into the distance

props.synopsis: Joanne Ciconte is the first Australian to score championship points in F1's all-female category, the first of potentially many accolades for the teenager.

title.children: Aussie teen creating history while settling into life in the fast lane

image.altText: Sloane Stephens sets up to return a ball with a backhand shot

props.synopsis: Female players who choose to undergo a fertility protection procedure will be allowed to take time away from the sport and return to competitive action with a protected ranking.

title.children: Female tennis players undergoing fertility procedures to get protected ranking

image.altText: Bell on its supports, before being stolen.

props.synopsis: An antique collector has found the bell in a skip after thieves used an angle grinder to remove it from a deconsecrated Hunter Valley church.

title.children: Town rejoices as stolen 185yo church bell found in scrap metal yard

image.altText: A man in a tracksuit is escorted into a police van by three officers.

props.synopsis: A 35-year-old man is in custody following the death of a 37-year-old man in Wagga Wagga earlier this week.

title.children: Man charged with murder after a shooting in southern NSW

image.altText: Ali Elmoubayed in tracksuit outside court

props.synopsis: Three people are arrested after bullets were fired into the house of an alleged Sydney crime figure shortly after he left for a scheduled court appearance.

title.children: 'Are Raptor there?': Alleged Sydney crime figure reacts to house shooting

image.altText: Frozen animated characters of a young man and a woman stand next to a snowman and elk.

props.synopsis: Disney and Universal file a copyright infringement lawsuit against an AI firm the Hollywood giants describe as a "bottomless pit of plagiarism".

title.children: Disney and Universal sue AI firm, label it 'bottomless pit of plagiarism'

image.altText: A brightly coloured cross leans against the base of a tree on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: Kyaharlem Hazard, 21, had been on parole for six days when the crash occurred in a Toowoomba suburb in 2023. His passenger, Heidi Riding, died at the scene.

title.children: Driver jailed for deadly crash in stolen car during police pursuit

image.altText: Police officers stand in front of a large house

props.synopsis: The bodies of the man and the woman were discovered inside a granny flat in Forestville, following a welfare check by police.

title.children: Couple found dead in Sydney granny flat had lacerations to bodies
